intro: Mimulus lewisii var. tetonensis, commonly known as the Teton monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange to yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as stream banks and meadows. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. This variant is distinguished by its more compact growth form compared to the typical Mimulus lewisii.
